column3: str

Kageel Ja is in need of seasonings.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Deliver the requested materials to Kageel Ja.

<If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),16))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Mine <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> near Iq Br'aax<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),17))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Gather <SheetEn(Item,3,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> near Iq Br'aax<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),2,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/><If(Equal(IntegerParameter(4),18))><If(LessThan(IntegerParameter(1),IntegerParameter(2)))>Catch <SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> at Xd'aa Talat Tsoly<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> to Kageel Ja</If><Else/></If></If></If>.

Mamook's traditional dishes tend to be sparse when it comes to seasonings. Aside from the salt taken from Bitterbark Cenote, the sweet flavoring provided by najool, and a fermented fish sauce, there isn't much else we add to our food.
So for those who have gone on to experience Tuliyollal's varied cuisine, our local fare is decidedly lacking in comparison.
On a related note, I've heard a Xbr'aal visitor mentioning certain ingredients found in the upper forest that might improve the taste of our vegetable soup...
The seasoning you acquired for us the last time has been praised by both the local Mamool Ja and our visiting Xbr'aal friends.
It's been so popular, in fact, that our stores are running dangerously low...
Would you be so kind as to bring back some of the rock salt found near Iq Br'aax? It's said to have a smoother flavor than the stuff we extract from Bitterbark.
Would you be so kind as to harvest some of the white pepper found near Iq Br'aax? It's said to have a spicy kick that enhances the flavor of the vegetables.
Would you be so kind as to pull up some algae from Xd'aa Talat Tsoly? It should go well with the soup once dried and ground into a powder.
Bait your hook with a golden stonefly nymph─an interested fish will drag the algae along for you to pluck free from the water.
The rock salt in question should be found in the vicinity of Iq Br'aax.
The white pepper in question should be found in the vicinity of Iq Br'aax.
You should be able to pull up the algae I spoke of from Xd'aa Talat Tsoly.
Attract the fish with golden stonefly nymphs and they'll bring the algae to you.
How went your hunt for seasonings?
Yes, this will do nicely. My thanks for braving the beasts of the Ut'ohmu Horizon.
Right, I say we get this ingredient prepared and popped into a soup straightaway. Hopefully our Mamook customers find the taste to their liking.
Glad I am that our choice of ingredient found favor with the customers. Our cooks, too, seem thrilled to have a new flavor to experiment with.
As it so happens, this flavor also complements tiika selvaas. Serving it with a side of tasty soup has only made our new dish all the more popular.
You know, if this can persuade even the studious Anggir to finish a meal over returning to her research, then I think we're onto a winner.
